text.p: Liechtenstein's hopes of collecting their first point of their World Cup qualifying campaign were dashed by two goals in the final 25 minutes of their group eight clash against Lithuania.
Second half substitute Tomas Razanauskas broke the deadlock after 65 minutes and Aurelijus Skarbalius added a second in the final minute to give Lithuania a 2-0 win.
Liechtenstien, beaten 11-1 by Macedonia last November, have conceded 31 goals and scored just three in six qualifiers.
